snippet: A homemade bomb exploded prematurely at 1626 Lexington Avenue, killing four people. Police identified the intended target as John D. Rockefeller, who had been embroiled in a labor dispute.
abstract: Homemade bomb that exploded prematurely on July 4, 1914, killing four people in a Lexington Ave tenement building, was part of an assassination plot against John D Rockefeller, whose family was embroiled in what has been called the deadliest labor dispute in American history; a century later, a jagged scar in the building's facade reminds passersby of structure's forgotten past.
lead_paragraph: A homemade bomb exploded prematurely at 1626 Lexington Avenue, killing four people. Police identified the intended target as John D. Rockefeller, who had been embroiled in a labor dispute.

headline.main: 100 Years Later, Scar Remains From a Strike’s Fatal Legacy in Manhattan
headline.print_headline: 100 Years Later, Scar Remains From Strike’s Fatal Legacy in Manhattan
